data.title: Daytona State College
data.meta_description: Offering more than 100 certificate, associate and bachelor’s degree programs, Daytona State College has responded to the education and workforce training needs of Volusia and Flagler counties and beyond for more than 60 years. The college enrolls nearly 24,000 students a year at its seven instructional sites, with graduates serving in critical fields including healthcare, emergency services, business, education, hospitality, engineering, technology and more. Daytona State has been recognized as a leader in higher education numerous times, consistently by U.S. News & World Report, which ranked the college among the Top Tier Best Online Bachelor’s Programs in the nation. The U.S. Department of Education’s College Affordability and Transparency Center ranks DSC among the top 50 most affordable public four-year institutions in the country, with less than half the tuition of the national average. Community College Week, a leading publication in higher education, annually continues to feature the college in its list of Top 100 Associate Degree Producers. And U.S. News & World Report ranks DSC among its Top Online Bachelor’s Programs for Veterans.
data.text:
Offering more than 100 certificate, associate and bachelor’s degree programs, Daytona State is the premier source for education and advanced training in Central Florida.

The College enrolls approximately 23,000 students a year at its seven instructional sites, with graduates serving in critical fields, including healthcare, emergency services, business, education, hospitality, engineering technology, computer science, and more.

Whether you know exactly what you want to do, or are still undecided, the program finder is a great place to start. You belong here!

Saturday, August 10 from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. on the Daytona Beach Campus.

Join us for a special Saturday Enrollment Day! Representatives will be available from Admissions, Academic Advising, Financial Aid, Registration, and Student Accounts. Enroll at DSC and register for your fall classes at this “one-stop” Saturday event.

Our first Residence Hall on the Daytona Beach Campus has been a resounding success since opening in Fall 2022. It is home to 256 students, has been at full capacity since its first day of operation, and applications exceed bed space by more than 300%!

Students who live on campus are more engaged with instructors, make more use of academic support services, participate in more on-campus activities, connect socially with peers, and build lifelong friendships that help them navigate financial and personal challenges that help them succeed far better in college and in life.

To meet this demand, we are embarking on the most ambitious private fundraising endeavor in the College’s history. And we need your help! We’ve set an ambitious goal to raise $15 million to build a second student Residence Hall on the Daytona Beach Campus and open it in Fall 2025.
